臀部寬度大於

passages.name: PA Office Real — p1
passages.content:
PA:
Please don't disturb the mayor.
passages.content_zh:
PA：
請不要打擾市長。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content: Licenses and Permits
passages.content_zh: 執照和許可證

passages.name: PA Office Real — p1
passages.content: Records

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
Receptionist:
Please stay out unless you have an
appointment.
passages.content_zh:
接待員：
請留在外面，除非您有
約會。

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p1
passages.content:
You walk up to the clerk, busily working at her
desk.

Clerk:
Hello, can I help you?

You let her know that you're here to drop off
the application for a food license.

Clerk:
Ah yes, of course.

She takes it and begins scanning over the
paper.

Clerk:
Yes, yes, this looks good...\!
Clear statement of intent...\!
All the signatures present...

She stamps it then sets it in a pile to the side.

Clerk:
Well, everything seems to be in order.\!
Just give us three to six months for processing
and you should receive your license!

Clerk:
Well *that's* not going to work.

You give her a sad look.

Clerk:
Look, you can't expect bureacracy to work
that fast!

You deploy puppy-dog eyes.

Clerk:
Okay, fine, I may be able to speed things up.\!
But you'll need to do me a favor first.

I've been too busy to deal with it, but we're
having a...\.\. situation in the basement.

Head down there and gather four rat tails
and I should be able to expedite your application.

You nod.\!
Honestly, it would be pretty great if you could
shortcut more bureacracy with basic fetch
quests.

Clerk:
Great. The stairs down are in records across
the hall.  I'll unlock the door for you.

She ducks out for a moment.
passages.content_zh:
你走到店員面前，忙著為她工作
辦公桌。

職員：
您好，需要什麼協助嗎？

你讓她知道你是來下車的
食品許可證申請。

職員：
啊，是的，當然。

她接過它並開始掃描
紙。

職員：
是的，是的，這看起來不錯......\！
明確的意向聲明...\！
所有簽名都在場...

她在上面蓋上印記，然後把它堆成一堆放在一邊。

職員：
好吧，一切似乎都井然有序。 \!
只需給我們三到六個月的處理時間
您應該會收到許可證！

職員：
好吧，那是行不通的。

你給她一個悲傷的表情。

職員：
聽著，你不能指望官僚主義能夠發揮作用
這麼快！

你展開小狗般的眼睛。

職員：
好吧，好吧，我也許可以加快速度。 \！
但你需要先幫我一個忙。

我太忙了，沒時間處理這件事，但我們
有一個...\.\.地下室的情況。

往下走，收集四根老鼠尾巴
我應該能夠加快您的申請。

你點點頭。 \!
老實說，如果可以的話那就太好了
透過基本的獲取快捷方式更多的官僚主義
任務。

職員：
太棒了。下樓梯有記錄
大廳。  我會為你打開門。

她躲了一會兒。

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p2
passages.content:
The clerk is busy reading through a massive
pile of paperwork.

Clerk:
Let me know when you've gathered the tails!
passages.content_zh:
店員正忙著翻閱海量的資料
一堆文書工作。

職員：
當你收集到尾巴時請告訴我！

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p3
passages.content:
Clerk:
You're back!

You glare at her.

Clerk:
What?

She blinks.

Clerk:
What didn't I explain? You just need to go
down into the basement, collect some tails,
and come back.

As far as I'm aware everyone should still be
down there.\!
Just hunt them down and get their tails.

How are you running into any problems?

Clerk:
Attack?!\!
You-\!
What?

Why?!

She gasps.

What have you done?!?!

You stare at each other for a moment in
mutual incomprehension.

You let her know that you need her to explain
again what she wanted you to do.

In detail.\!
Using very small words.

Clerk:
I need you to go downstairs and collect tails
from the people there.

You know, their stories.\!
Interview them!

...Tales.\!
*Tales*.\!
Oh.

Clerk:
Look, the interns all went feral a few days
ago and won't come out of the basement.

They all started dressing up like rats and
proclaiming that soon their "great
underground empire" would rule the world.

I'm all good with make-believe, but not if it
gets in the way of doing your filing!\!
And I *highly* doubt any expansion of their
"empire" is following building codes.

She composes herself.

Clerk:
Here at city hall we pride ourselves on
providing a nurturing environment for all
citizens of our city, interns included.

At the very least we need to know why they've
all gone feral so we can make the program
better next year.

But I've been so busy with all the work they
dropped that I haven't had time to go down
and ask them.

\}Also they seem to have decided I'm a devil
figure in their new culture and I can only take
so many attempted exorcisms a day...

That's why I need someone else to go down
and get their responses!\!
Their tales.

Clerk:
Please tell me you didn't hurt them.

Corporal punishment has been illegal since
the eighties, and would *not* help you get
your business license earlier.

You indicate that hurting them was never on
your mind. Obviously.

She sighs in relief.

Clerk:
Thank goodness.

Well, if we have cleared up this
passages.content_zh:
職員：
你回來了！

你瞪著她。

職員：
什麼？

她眨了眨眼。

職員：
我沒解釋什麼？你只需要走
進入地下室，收集一些尾巴，
然後回來。

據我所知，每個人都應該還是
在那下面。 \！
只要追捕他們並得到他們的尾巴即可。

你是如何遇到問題的？

職員：
攻擊？ ！ \！
你-\！
什麼？

為什麼？ ！

她喘著氣。

你做了什麼？ ！ ？ ！

你們對視了一會兒
互相不理解。

你讓她知道你需要她解釋
再說一次她想讓你做什麼。

詳細。 \！
使用非常小的字。

職員：
我需要你下樓收集尾巴
來自那裡的人們。

你知道，他們的故事。 \！
採訪他們！

....故事。 \！
*故事*.\!
哦。

職員：
你看，這幾天實習生都瘋了
以前不會從地下室出來。

他們都開始打扮得像老鼠一樣
宣稱很快他們的「偉大
地下帝國」將統治世界。

我很喜歡假裝，但如果真的假裝的話就不行了
妨礙您進行歸檔！ \！
我*高度*懷疑他們的任何擴張
「帝國」遵循建築規範。

她鎮定下來。

職員：
在市政廳，我們感到自豪
為所有人提供一個培育環境
我們城市的公民，包括實習生。

至少我們需要知道他們為什麼
一切都變得野性，所以我們可以製作節目
明年會更好。

但我一直忙於他們的所有工作
掉下來我還來不及下去
並詢問他們。

\}他們似乎也認定我是魔鬼
他們的新文化中的形象，我只能採取
一天有很多次嘗試驅魔.....

這就是為什麼我需要別人下去
並得到他們的回應！ \!
他們的故事。

職員：
請告訴我你沒有傷害他們。

體罰自此以來一直是非法的
八十年代，並且*不會*幫助您獲得
早點拿到營業執照。

你表明傷害他們從來沒有發生過
你的想法。明顯地。

她鬆了一口氣。

職員：
感謝上帝。

好吧，如果我們解決了這個問題

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p4
passages.content:
The clerk has gone back to her paperwork.

Clerk:
Let me know when you've gotten the stories
from four of the rats-slash-interns.\!
\}Rinterns?

And no fighting!
passages.content_zh:
職員又回去處理她的文書工作了。

職員：
當你收到故事時請告訴我
來自四個老鼠斜線實習生。 \！
\}實習生？

而且沒有戰鬥！

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p5
passages.content:
Clerk:
You've polled all the interns?\!
Thank you!

She listens closely to your report.

Clerk:
Okay, so I can see some changes we might
make for next year's staff.

Free coffee.

Less peer pressure.

More help with job placement afterwards.

And giving interns the ability to call for
corporate executions.

We'll keep all of these in mind!

She smiles and pulls out the pet shelter cafe
form.

Clerk:
And as promised, here you go!

She stamps a big "APPROVED" across it.

Clerk:
I look forward to visiting!
passages.content_zh:
職員：
你對所有實習生進行了民意調查嗎？ \!
謝謝你！

她仔細地聽你的報告。

職員：
好的，所以我可以看到一些我們可能會做出的改變
為明年的員工做準備。

免費咖啡。

减少同侪压力。

之後為就業安置提供更多協助。

並賦予實習生打電話的能力
企业处决。

這些我們都會牢記在心！

她微笑著拉出了寵物收容所咖啡館
形式。

職員：
正如所承諾的，給你！

她在上面蓋上了大大的“批准”字樣。

職員：
我期待着来访！

passages.name: PA Office Real — Licenses clerk — p6
passages.content:
The clerk has gone back to her paperwork.

Clerk:
Thanks again for all your help!
passages.content_zh:
職員又回去處理她的文書工作了。

職員：
再次感謝您的所有幫助！

passages.name: PA Office Real — p1
passages.content:
Your glasses turn on.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
This cannot-

She gives a big yawn.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
This cannot stand, nya!

\n[4]:
Oh great, you again.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Please, Lovely Warrior Lovey \n[10]!

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Please, Lovely Princess \n[10]-chan!
passages.content_zh:
你的眼鏡打開了。

愛與正義的可愛精神：
這不能——

她打了個大大的哈欠。

愛與正義的可愛精神：
這不能忍受，哎呀！

\n[4]:
喔太好了，又是你。

愛與正義的可愛精神：
拜託了，可愛的戰士可愛\n[10]！

愛與正義的可愛精神：
拜託了，可愛的公主\n[10]-chan！

passages.name: PA Office Real — p2
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Well then, Lovely Princess \n[10]-chan,
if you're already serving the cause of love
and justice, would you like some more power?

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Then hold up your compact and shout your
love and joy to the world!

"Magic up."

'Magical makeup powers!\!
Make me the prettiest maiden of love and
justice!'
passages.content_zh:
愛與正義的可愛精神：
那麼，可愛的公主\n[10]-chan，
如果你已經在為愛情事業服務
還有正義，你想要更多的力量嗎？

愛與正義的可愛精神：
然後舉起你的粉盒並大聲喊出你的
為世界帶來愛和歡樂！

“魔法起來。”

'神奇的化妝能力！ \！
讓我成為最美麗的愛情少女
正義！

passages.name: PA Office Real — Spirit cutscene — p1
passages.content:
Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh no, Lovely Warrior Lovey \n[10]!\!
This can't be!

She yawns and rubs her eyes.

While I was sleeping a new threat has arisen!\!
Puppies and kitties and everything that is
right in this world lies in danger once more!\!
The cafe must open!

Please!\!
Lovely Maiden \n[10]-chan!\!
Say you will help!

Kaede:
...\.\.But we hast already resolved to lend
our aid.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh, uh...

\n[4]:
You're late!

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Oh.\!
Huh.

Lovely Spirit of Love and Justice:
Well.\!
Good luck then.

I must go renew my energy!\!
For love and justice!

\n[4] scowls.

\n[4]:
She's just going back to sleep, isn't she.\!
So unprofessional.
passages.content_zh:
愛與正義的可愛精神：
喔不，可愛的戰士可愛\n[10]！ \！
這不可能！

她打哈欠，揉眼睛。

當我睡覺時，新的威脅出現了！ \！
小狗和小貓以及所有的東西
這個世界又陷入危險！ \！
咖啡館必須開業！

請！ \！
可愛的少女\n[10]-chan!\!
說你會幫忙！

楓：
....\.\.但是我們已經決定要藉錢了
我們的援助。

愛與正義的可愛精神：
哦，呃...

\n[4]:
你遲到了！

愛與正義的可愛精神：
哦。 \!
呵呵。

愛與正義的可愛精神：
好吧。 \!
那麼祝你好運。

我必須去補充能量！ \！
為了愛和正義！

\n[4] 皺起眉頭。

\n[4]:
她只是要回去睡覺了，不是嗎？ \！
太不專業了。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
Receptionist:
The licenses office is to the left.
passages.content_zh:
接待員：
許可證辦公室位於左側。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
County Tax Code, Volumes XLIII - LXIX
2017 Edition

The shelves are filled with reference tomes.\!
You're feeling bored already and you haven't
even touched them.
passages.content_zh:
縣稅法，第 XLIII 卷 - LXIX
2017年版

書架上擺滿了參考書目。 \！
你已經感到無聊了，但你還沒有
甚至觸碰了他們。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
The shelves are filled with boring reference
tomes.\!
Tax codes, municipal laws, form binders...

Wait, what's this?

Something is almost hidden between a few
massive volumes.

"Audited by Adoration: The steamy tale of two
tax attornies discovering love; and that it is a
treasure greater than any reported using
IRS Form 1040 Line 21."

Clerk:
Don't, uh...\!
No idea how that got there.

\}Please put it back.
passages.content_zh:
書架上擺滿了無聊的參考資料
書籍。 \！
稅法、市政法律、表格活頁夾...

等等，這是什麼？

有些東西幾乎隱藏在幾個人之間
大量的。

《崇拜》審核：兩個人的熱辣故事
稅務律師發現愛；它是一個
寶藏比任何報道的使用都要多
IRS 表格 1040 第 21 行。 」

職員：
別，呃...\！
不知道那是怎麼到那裡的。

\}請把它放回去。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content: Looks like old tax records.
passages.content_zh: 看起來像舊的稅務記錄。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
Looks like material for a prospective ad
campaign.

"Running A City Is Expensive:
Why We Can't Provide All The Things We'd
Really Really Like To"

It's been stamped REJECTED.\!
"Ad campaigns are also expensive!"
passages.content_zh:
看起來像是潛在廣告的材料
活動。

「管理一座城市是昂貴的：
為什麼我們不能提供我們想要的所有東西
真的真的很喜欢”

它已被標記為“已拒絕”。 \！
“廣告活動也很昂貴！”

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
Construction regulations.

Fun fact! Did you know that nonmetallic-
sheathed cable is required to be secured by
insulated fittings at intervals not exceeding
4.5 feet?

You back away before you have to learn any
more fun facts.
passages.content_zh:
施工規範。

有趣的事實！你知道非金屬-
護套電纜需要透過以下方式固定
絕緣配件的間隔不超過
4.5英尺？

在你必須學習任何東西之前你就退縮了
更多有趣的事實。

passages.name: PA Office Real
passages.content:
More old tax records.\!
You try to take a look, but your eyes glaze
over as soon as you open a folder.
passages.content_zh:
更多舊稅務記錄。 \!
你試著看一眼，但你的目光呆滯
打開資料夾後立即結束。

passages.name: Basement — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Rat?:
AAAAAAAAAAAAH!\!
Alert!\! Alarm!\!
Danger! Danger!

She runs off deeper into the basement.

Rat?:
THEY'VE COME FOR US!\!
THEY'VE FINALLY COME FOR US!

WE'RE DOOOOOOOOOOOOMED!!!!!!!!!!!

\n[2]:
We're not actually going to hunt her down,
right?

The poor thing seemed traumatized enough
already.\!
\}Did other people come hunting them before?

\n[4]:
No one said we had to *kill* her.\!
Even a relative simpleton can see an
alternative!

We just beat her up a little and then cut off
her tail.

Think of the fetch quests we could avoid!

\n[2]:
The cafe isn't worth this.\!
We're not actually going to attack her and her
friends, right \n[10]?

Please tell me we aren't.

Kaede:
Aye, tis not a path I wouldst support.\!
It sits poorly with me to disfigure a beast
that seems to bear us no ill will.

Methinks the true villain lies above.\!
'Tis the one who gavest us this mission who
shouldst be the true target of our ire.

\n[4]:
Fine, fine.\!
As long as we get to do violence to
*someone*.

\n[2]:
Let's just go see what that clerk says about
this, okay?\!
Maybe there's a good explanation?
passages.content_zh:
老鼠？ ：
啊啊啊啊！ \!
警報！ \！警報！ \！
危險！危險！

她跑進地下室深處。

老鼠？ ：
他們來找我們了！ \！
他們終於來找我們了！

我們真是太棒了!!!!!!!!!!!!

\n[2]:
我們其實不是要追捕她
對嗎？

這可憐的東西似乎受了足夠的創傷
已經。 \!
\}以前有其他人來獵殺過它們嗎？

\n[4]:
沒有人說我們必須「殺死」她。 \！
即使是相對簡單的人也能看到
另類！

我們只是打了她一下然後就切斷了聯繫
她的尾巴。

想想我們可以避免的取物任務！

\n[2]:
咖啡館不值得這個。 \!
我們實際上不會攻擊她和她
朋友們，對嗎\n[10]？

請告訴我我們不是。

楓：
是的，這不是我所支持的道路。 \！
破壞野獸的樣子對我來說很不舒服
這似乎對我們沒有惡意。

我認為真正的惡棍就在上面。 \！
是那個賦予我們這使命的人
應該是我們憤怒的真正目標。

\n[4]:
好吧好吧。 \!
只要我們能夠對他人實施暴力
*某人*。

\n[2]:
我們去看看店員怎麼說
這個，好嗎？ \！
也許有一個很好的解釋？

passages.name: Basement — Blocker — p1
passages.content:
You can still hear someone screaming "they're
coming, they're coming!" in the distance.

It's...\.\. it's probably best to figure out what's
going on first, before you head farther in.
passages.content_zh:
你仍然可以聽到有人尖叫“他們是
來了，他們來了！ 」在遠處。

它是...\。 \。最好弄清楚是什麼
在你繼續前進之前，先繼續。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p3
passages.content:
Rat Guard:
Hey.

You both pause as you hear shrieks in the
distance.

Rat:
THEY'RE BACK!!\!
WE'RE DOOOOOOOOOMED!

The guard sighs and pinches the bridge of her
nose.

Rat Guard:
Just checking, you're not here to "beat us
down, crush our dreams, and drive us
weeping before you", right?

You let her know that you'd never even think
of doing such a thing.\!
Never even crossed your mind.

You'd never want to do any violence to them,
*especially* not anything involving their tails.

Rat Guard:
That seems like a weirdly specific denial but
okay.

What are you here for then?

You let them know you're just here to survey
them about their internship.

Rat Guard:
...Right.

Rat Guard:
Well, whatever.\!
You can talk to people as long as you don't
make a mess.
passages.content_zh:
鼠衛：
嘿。

當你們聽到尖叫聲時，你們都停了下來
距離。

老鼠：
他們回來了！ ！ ！
我們真是太棒了！

侍衛嘆了口氣，捏住她的鼻樑
鼻子。

鼠衛：
只是檢查了一下，你不是來“打敗我們的”
下來，粉碎我們的夢想，並驅使我們
在你面前哭泣”，對嗎？

你讓她知道你永遠不會想到
做這樣的事。 \!
你甚至從未想過。

你永遠不想對他們施加任何暴力
*特別是*不要涉及任何涉及它們尾巴的東西。

鼠衛：
這似乎是一個奇怪的具體否認，但是
好的。

那你來這裡幹什麼？

你讓他們知道你只是來這裡調查
他們關於他們的實習。

鼠衛：
……對。

鼠衛：
好吧，無論如何。 \！
只要不說話，就可以與人交談
弄得一團糟。

passages.name: Basement — Guard after — p1
passages.content:
Rat Guard:
Hey.

You ask her why she left her internship.

Rat Guard:
Eh, all my friends were doing it.\!
And this is more interesting than doing data
entry.

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.
passages.content_zh:
鼠衛：
嘿。

你問她為什麼要離開實習。

鼠衛：
呃，我所有的朋友都在這麼做。 \！
這比做數據更有趣
條目。

這就是您被要求收集的所有故事。 \！
您現在可以把它們帶到店員那裡。

passages.name: Basement — Guard after — p2
passages.content:
Mouse:
Look, I don't have a problem with peer
pressure.

That's what all my friends say and I believe
them.
passages.content_zh:
滑鼠：
聽著，我和同伴之間沒有問題
壓力。

我所有的朋友都這麼說，我也相信
他們。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p1
passages.content:
Mouse:
Why did I leave the internship?\!
No, no, I had no problems with it.

It was pretty great actually!\!
It's just, you know...

The job scene is pretty cutthroat out there.\!
I have to think of myself.\!
"Started secret underground empire" just
looks so much better on a resume!

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.
passages.content_zh:
滑鼠：
我為什麼要離開實習？ \!
不，不，我對此沒有任何問題。

實際上非常棒！ \!
只是，你知道...

那裡的工作場景相當殘酷。 \!
我得為我自己著想。 \!
「開始秘密地下帝國」剛剛
履歷看起來好多了！

這就是您被要求收集的所有故事。 \！
您現在可以把它們帶到店員那裡。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p2
passages.content:
Mouse:
Being an Imperial Viceroy should get me past
the entry-level jobs!
passages.content_zh:
滑鼠：
成為帝國總督應該讓我過去
入門級工作！

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p1
passages.content:
The mousegirl blinks blearily when you ask
about the internship.

Mouse:
Why?\!
No coffee.

She yawns.

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.
passages.content_zh:
當你問的時候，老鼠女孩睡眼惺忪地眨著眼睛
關於實習。

滑鼠：
為什麼？ \!
沒有咖啡。

她打哈欠。

這就是您被要求收集的所有故事。 \！
您現在可以把它們帶到店員那裡。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p2
passages.content: The mousegirl has fallen asleep.
passages.content_zh: 鼠女已經睡著了。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p1
passages.content:
Mouse:
The internship?\!
Of course I took something better!

She scoffs.

Mouse:
Look, I took this job for one reason.

Businesses *need* licenses to operate.\!
Licenses from this office.\!
Its hand is wrapped tight around the very
beating heart of commerce in this city.

I thought I'd get to decide what businesses
live and die!\!
To stand at the center of things and thrill with
power!

But it was just *filing*.\!
Of course I left!

That's all the stories you were asked to collect.\!
You can take them to the clerk now.
passages.content_zh:
滑鼠：
實習？ \!
當然我拿了更好的東西！

她嗤之以鼻。

滑鼠：
聽著，我接受這份工作是有原因的。

企業*需要*許可證才能運作。 \！
來自該辦公室的許可證。 \!
它的手緊緊地包裹著
這座城市的商業中心。

我以為我可以決定哪些業務
生與死！ \！
站在事物的中心並激動不已
力量！

但這只是*歸檔*。 \！
我當然離開了！

這就是您被要求收集的所有故事。 \！
您現在可以把它們帶到店員那裡。

passages.name: Basement — Mouse — p2
passages.content:
Mouse:
Someday, all shall cower in fear of my wrath!
passages.content_zh:
滑鼠：
總有一天，所有人都會因我的憤怒而畏縮！

passages.name: Basement — Guard 2
passages.content:
Rat Guard:
No entrance.

The secrets of our underground civilization
are not for the likes of you.
passages.content_zh:
鼠衛：
沒有入口。

我們地下文明的秘密
不適合你這樣的人。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the M section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

Found 1000 gold!

Filed under "Money".
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 M 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

找到1000金幣！

歸檔在「錢」下。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the U section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

Found trash panties!

Filed under "Underwear, Used".\!
...Ew.
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 U 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

發現垃圾內褲！

歸檔於「二手內衣」下方。 \！
....呃。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through.\!
Huh, looks like the city is spending a *ton*
of money on road maintenance.
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽一下。 \!
嗯，看起來這個城市花了很多*噸*
的錢用於道路維護。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

Found 500 gold!

Filed under S for "Secret Stash".
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽一下。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

找到500金幣！

在 S 下歸檔為「秘密藏匿」。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the W section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

"Weird Rock".

Found raw mana!
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 W 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

「奇怪的岩石」。

發現原始法力！

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the C section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

"Cool Rock".

Found raw mana!
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 C 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

「酷搖滾」。

發現原始法力！

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the S section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

Found...\! old cheese?

"Snacks".

Mouse:
Hey, hands off! \!
I'm saving that for later!
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 S 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

成立...\！老奶酪？

「零食」。

滑鼠：
嘿，把手拿開！ \！
我把它留著以後用！

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.

You browse through the M section.\!
Oh hey, here's something!

A mouse has built a cozy nest out of the files.\!
They squeak at you.

Someone has helpfully labeled it "Mouse".
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

您瀏覽 M 部分。 \!
喔嘿，這裡有東西！

一隻老鼠在文件中搭建了一個舒適的巢穴。 \!
他們對你吱吱叫。

有人給它貼上了「老鼠」的標籤。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through the A section.\!
There's a big folder labeled "Absolutely Not
Pornography".

.\..\..\..It's porn.
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽 A 部分。 \!
有一個大文件夾，標有“絕對不是”
色情」。

.\..\..\..這是色情片。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through.\!
You don't find anything valuable, but you learn
lots about civic governance.

Looks like garbage collection is expensive!
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽一下。 \!
你沒有發現任何有價值的東西，但你學到了
關於公民治理的很多內容。

看來垃圾收集的成本很高！

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through.\!
You don't find anything valuable, but you learn
lots about civic governance.

Apparently the founders of the town thought
it would be much bigger than it is, so they
built surprisingly spacious sewers.
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽一下。 \!
你沒有發現任何有價值的東西，但你學到了
關於公民治理的很多內容。

顯然該鎮的創始人認為
它會比現在大得多，所以他們
建造了令人驚訝的寬敞下水道。

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through the R section.\!
Huh, there's a folder here labeled "Random
Encounter."

\n[4]:
Finally, some violence!
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽 R 部分。 \!
嗯，這裡有一個標有“Random”的資料夾
相遇。 」

\n[4]:
最後來點暴力！

passages.name: Basement — Bookshelf
passages.content:
Old files.

You browse through but don't find anything
interesting.
passages.content_zh:
舊文件。

您瀏覽但沒有找到任何內容
有趣的。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer
passages.content:
The pet shelter volunteer is talking to a pair
of animal control officers.

Animal Control:
So we're looking for a pair of strays who
caused a lot of damage, a black-haired
catgirl and a brown-haired doggirl.

Do you know of anyone who could have done
it?

Shelter Volunteer:
No...\!
I'm sure no one here could have done it...

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are you sure it's not the shelter heads?

They look so close!

Animal Control:
Of course not officer!\!
Look at them, they're much too busty to be
who we were chasing the other day.

Animal Control:
I guess...
passages.content_zh:
寵物收容所志工正在與一對夫婦交談
動物管制官員。

動物管制：
所以我們正在尋找一對流浪者
造成了極大的傷害，黑髮
貓女孩和棕色頭髮的狗女孩。

你知道有誰可以做到嗎
它？

庇護所志工：
不...\！
我確信這裡沒有人能做到這一點......

動物管制：
先生！ \!
確定不是避難所的負責人嗎？

他們看起來很親密！

動物管制：
當然不是軍官！ \！
看看她們，胸部太大了
那天我們在追誰。

動物管制：
我猜...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Let's see, where should the rest of the cat
beds go...
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
讓我們看看，貓的其餘部分應該在哪裡
床去...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Is it just me, or did everything just get louder?
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
只有我一個人這樣，還是一切都變得更大聲了？

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer / animal control — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Each batch of the catnip tea just keeps getting
better.
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
每一批貓薄荷茶都在不斷獲得
更好。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer / animal control — p2
passages.content:
Animal Control:
This tea is amazing!
passages.content_zh:
動物管制：
這茶太棒了！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Are you here to help with setting up the cafe?

You nod.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good.\!
Excellent.

She looks around the shelter.

Shelter Head Felix:
Let's see...\!
We've got enough people setting up the
tables...

We've got people testing out menu items...\!
People cleaning up the place...

Where should we put you?

Doug calls out from behind the counter.

Shelter Head Doug:
Papers!

Shelter Head Felix:
Right, the paperwork!

She hands you a set of papers.

Shelter Head Felix:
Here, this is the form to apply for a food
license for the shelter.

If you could just take it to city hall and drop
it off with the permits office.\!
Get us that license and we should be able to
open tomorrow!

There's scattered cheering from the volunteers
around the shelter.

Town Hall destination added to bus stop!

Shelter Head Felix:
Alright everyone, back to work!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
您是來幫忙開設咖啡館的嗎？

你點點頭。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
好。 \!
出色的。

她環視避難所。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
讓我們來看看...\!
我們有足夠的人來設置
桌子...

我們有人在測試選單項目...\！
人們正在清理這個地方...

我們該把你放在哪裡？

道格在櫃檯後面喊道。

庇護所負責人道格：
論文！

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
對了，文書工作！

她遞給你一套文件。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
這是申請食品的表格
庇護所的許可證。

如果你能把它帶到市政廳然後放下
與許可證辦公室關閉。 \！
給我們許可證，我們應該能夠
明天營業！

志工們零星地發出歡呼聲
避難所周圍。

市政廳目的地已添加到巴士站！

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
好了大家回去工作吧！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
You've returned!\!
How did it go?

You hand her the approved form.

Shelter Head Felix:
Excellent.\!
Thank you for your assistance.

Shelter Head Doug:
She did it?!

Shelter Head Felix:
She did it!

Felix turns to the rest of the room and cups
her hands around her mouth.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good news everyone, we're approved to
open tomorrow!

The volunteers all cheer.

She turns back to Doug.

Shelter Head Felix:
We're actually doing this!

One more step towards making a home for
all cats and dogs!

Shelter Head Doug:
And all dogs and cats!

They hug.

Then begin to glow.

Once more you hear cries of joy as the best
dog and cat bless their unity.\!
And their hearts (and other parts) swell with
joy.

Shelter Head Doug:
Hooray!

Shelter Head Felix:
I can't wait!

They're too excited to notice their hug loosen,
as blossoming chests push them apart.

And then the power crests and rolls out across
the shelter.\!
Tails and ears pop up on the volunteers who
had not yet sampled the teas.

It hits you and you find yourself reaching up
into the air, your magical compact suddenly in
hand.

Words come unbidden to your mouth.

Magical Makeup Powers!

You rise up into the air, spinning and glowing
and briefly flashing your panties to everyone
around.

The volunteers applaud politely.
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
你回來了！ \!
進展如何？

你把批准的表格交給她。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
太棒了。 \!
感謝您的協助。

庇護所負責人道格：
她做到了？ ！

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
她做到了！

菲利克斯轉向房間的其餘部分和杯子
她雙手摀著嘴。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
大家好消息，我們已獲得批准
明天營業！

志工們紛紛歡呼。

她轉身面向道格。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
我們實際上正在做這個！

為安家又邁出了一步
所有的貓和狗！

庇護所負責人道格：
還有所有的狗和貓！

他們擁抱。

然後開始發光。

你再一次聽到歡呼聲是最好的
狗和貓祝福他們的團結。 \！
他們的心（和其他部分）隨著
喜悅。

庇護所負責人道格：
萬歲！

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
我等不及了！

他們太興奮了，沒有註意到他們的擁抱鬆開了，
盛開的箱子將他們推開。

然後力量達到頂峰並鋪開
庇護所。 \！
志工們的尾巴和耳朵突然出現
還沒品嚐過茶。

它擊中了你，你發現自己伸手去拿
飛向空中，你的魔法契約突然在
手。

言語不由自主地出現在你的嘴裡。

化妝的神奇力量！

你升到空中，旋轉並發光
向大家短暫展示你的內褲
周圍。

志工們禮貌地鼓掌。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Autoplay — p5
passages.content:
You walk in on a bustling scene, full of
customers trying out the new drinks and
playing with the animals.

Felix calls to you from across the room.

Shelter Head Felix:
Our gratitude again for the help yesterday!\!
Just grab a seat wherever!
passages.content_zh:
你走進一片繁華的景象，充滿了
顧客嘗試新飲品並
和動物一起玩。

菲利克斯從房間的另一邊呼喚你。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
我們再次感謝昨天的幫忙！ \！
隨便找個位子就可以了！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Doug — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
We're so close to turning this into a real
pet cafe!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人道格：
我們非常接近將其變成現實
寵物咖啡館！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Doug — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
We're all ready to start tomorrow!\!
Come check us out then!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人道格：
我们已经准备好明天开始了！ \!
那就來看看我們吧！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
This is so exciting!\!
Making the shelter into a cafe is going to
help so much with adoptions!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
這太令人興奮了！ \!
將避難所改造成咖啡館
對收養有很大幫助！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
So many more people are coming now that
we're a cafe!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
現在有更多的人來
我們是一家咖啡館！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer — p1
passages.content:
This man is staring into a cat's eyes over a
cup of catnip tea.

Customer:
No!\!
No tea for you!

Customer:
No!\!
I said the tea is mine!

Customer:
That's enough!

He chugs the entire cup and slams it back
down to the table.

Customer:
Hah!

He puts his arms behind his head and
stretches.

Customer:
The sweet taste of victory!

He doesn't seem to notice the way he loses
height as he stretches, sinking down in the
seat.

Or the way his shorts slide down off his
thinning waist, only to catch on his wider
hips.

He's too busy giving the cat a smug look to
pay attention as the bottom half of his shirt
just fades into dust, revealing a nice stretch
of rapidly swelling underboob.

Or the way his hair shades suddenly to violet,
dropping down to his shoulders in wild curls.

Customer:
I'm so sorry kitty, it's too bad you can't afford
to buy your own.\!
Get a job you freeloader!

He's just too busy gloating at the cat glaring
at him, even as his ears fuzz out and grow
points, shifting up to the top of his head.

Even as his lower pants make way for a tail to
snake out behind him.

Even as his face softens and his voice pitches
ever higher.

Customer:
Hah!\!
Suck it!
passages.content_zh:
這個男人正凝視著一隻貓的眼睛
一杯貓薄荷茶。

客戶：
不！ \！
沒有茶給你喝！

客戶：
不！ \！
我說茶是我的！

客戶：
夠了！

他喝掉整個杯子，然後又把它摔回去
下到桌子上。

客戶：
哈！

他將雙臂放在腦後
伸展。

客戶：
勝利的甜蜜滋味！

他似乎沒有註意到他是如何失敗的
當他伸展時的高度，沉入水中
座位。

或者他的短褲從他身上滑落的方式
腰細了，才趕上他的寬
臀部。

他正忙著給那隻貓做出得意的表情
注意他襯衫的下半部分
只是消失在塵埃中，露出美麗的伸展
胸部下迅速腫脹。

或者他的頭髮突然變成紫羅蘭色，
狂野的捲髮垂到肩膀。

客戶：
我很抱歉小貓，可惜你買不起
自己買。 \！
找工作吧，你這個貪圖便宜的人！

他只是忙著幸災樂禍地看著那隻瞪著眼睛的貓
看著他，即使他的耳朵已經模糊並長大
點，移動到他的頭頂。

即使他的下褲讓位給尾巴
蛇形地從他身後走出來。

即使他的臉色變得柔和，聲音也變高了
更高。

客戶：
哈！ \！
吸它！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer — p2
passages.content:
The new woman is still taunting the cat.

Customer:
Too bad kitty, that was a delicious cup of tea!
passages.content_zh:
新來的女人還在嘲笑那隻貓。

客戶：
太糟糕了，小貓，那是一杯美味的茶！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Sale customer
passages.content:
Customer:
Like my outfit? I just got it at the sale down
the street.

She takes a sip of her catnip tea.

Customer:
Ah, the taste of stylish victory.
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
喜歡我的服裝嗎？我剛在打折時買到的
街道。

她抿了一口貓薄荷茶。

客戶：
啊，時尚勝利的味道。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6
passages.content: A tree that looks perfectly fine to you.
passages.content_zh: 一棵對你來說看起來非常好的樹。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p1
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
I can't wait to share this tea with everyone!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
我迫不及待想與大家分享這茶！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Welcome!\!
Can I get you anything?

I recommend the catnip tea for cat lovers and
the spice tea for dog lovers!

Shelter Volunteer:
Sorry, you don't have enough money!

The tea is delicious!

You feel briefly itchy, as your ears gain a point
and your tail thins down and stretches out.

You feel briefly itchy as your ears gain a point.

Sticks suddenly seem a lot less interesting.\!
You could really go for batting around a mouse,
and maybe licking your butt.

You feel the catnip speaking to something
deep within you.\!
As if a switch in your soul has just changed
from "dog" to "cat".

Something about the catnip is just wonderful
to you.\!
So calming, so soothing...

Shelter Volunteer:
Sorry, you don't have enough money!

Mmm, the spice tea is wonderful!\!
The best part is chewing on the cinnamon
stick they included.

You pant a little, as your ears flop out and
your tail gets a lot more fluffy.

You pant a little in excitement as your ears
flop out.

The catnip tea is smelling a lot more boring
now.\!
You'd rather go for a walk.\!
Ooo, and maybe chase some squirrels!

Your tail wags eagerly at the thought.

Something about it really makes you want to
chew more sticks.\!
And maybe shoes.\!
Ooo, and chase sticks too!

You feel something shift within your soul.\!
As if a switch deep within you has just
changed from "cat" to "dog".

Sticks are wonderful, aren't they?\!
Yeah!\!
You could chew on this thing forever!

Shelter Volunteer:
Just let me know if you want anything!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
歡迎光臨！ \!
我能給你什麼嗎？

我向愛貓人士推薦貓薄荷茶
愛狗人士的香料茶！

庇護所志工：
抱歉，你的錢不夠！

茶很好吃！

當您的耳朵達到一定程度時，您會感到短暫的搔癢
你的尾巴變細並伸展。

當您的耳朵達到某個點時，您會感到短暫的發癢。

棍子突然顯得沒那麼有趣了。 \！
你真的可以去圍著老鼠打球，
也許還會舔你的屁股。

你感覺到貓薄荷在對某件事說話
在你內心深處。 \!
彷彿你靈魂的開關剛剛改變
從“狗”到“貓”。

貓薄荷的某些東西真是太棒了
給你。 \！
如此平靜，如此舒緩…

庇護所志工：
抱歉，你的錢不夠！

嗯，香料茶太棒了！ \！
最好的部分是咀嚼肉桂
堅持他們包括在內。

當你的耳朵垂下來時，你有點氣喘吁籲
你的尾巴會變得更加蓬鬆。

你的耳朵興奮得有點喘氣
失敗了。

貓薄荷茶聞起來更無聊了
現在。 \!
你寧願去散步。 \!
噢，也許還可以追一些松鼠！

一想到這裡，你的尾巴就會急切地搖動。

它的某些東西確實讓你想要
多嚼幾根棍子。 \！
也許還有鞋子。 \！
哦，還有追逐棒！

你感覺到你的靈魂裡有什麼東西改變了。 \！
彷彿你內心深處的一個開關剛剛
從「貓」變成了「狗」。

棍子很棒，不是嗎？ \！
是的！ \！
你可以永遠咀嚼這個東西！

庇護所志工：
如果您想要什麼，請告訴我！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Tea
passages.content: Catnip tea is steeping on the counter.
passages.content_zh: 櫃檯上正在泡貓薄荷茶。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Felix — p1
passages.content:
Felix is directing the volunteers.

Shelter Head Felix:
Good work so far everyone!

Roberta, make sure to scatter the cat beds
so they have somewhere to hide! We don't
want them to feel too exposed!

Sarah, make sure the next test batch of tea
is ready for the tasting!

Maurice, make sure there are plenty of toys
for the dogs!\!
And give me one of those too!
passages.content_zh:
菲利克斯正在指揮志願者。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
到目前為止大家都做得很好！

羅伯塔，一定要把貓床弄散
所以他們有地方可以藏！我們不
希望他們感覺太暴露了！

莎拉，確保下一批測試茶
已準備好品嚐！

莫里斯，確保有足夠的玩具
為了狗！ \！
也給我其中一份吧！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Felix — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
Once more you have my gratitude for
procuring the forms for us.

Come back tomorrow to see the fruits of
our labors!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
我再次感謝你
為我們採購表格。

明天再來看看成果
我們的勞動！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Donation jars
passages.content:
There are two donation jars here, labeled
CATS and DOGS.

It looks like they have exactly the same
amount of money in each.

Donate?

As you put in the money you see Doug twitch,
then visibly restrain themselves.

Shelter Head Doug:
(It's okay, it's okay. Both dogs and cats are
fine.)

You don't have enough money!

You see Felix visibly restraining themselves.

Shelter Head Felix:
(We made an agreement. We don't need
complete parity anymore. Either animal is
fine. Either animal is fine.)

You don't have enough money!

You leave the jars alone.
passages.content_zh:
這裡有兩個捐款罐，貼標籤
貓和狗。

看起來他們有完全相同的
每項金額。

捐？

當你投入錢時，你會看到道格抽搐，
然後明顯克制自己。

庇護所負責人道格：
（沒關係，沒關係，狗和貓都是
很好。 ）

你錢不夠！

你看到菲利克斯明顯地克制自己。

庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
（我們已經達成協議。我們不需要
完全平等了。任一動物是
很好。任何一種動物都可以。 ）

你錢不夠！

你別管罐子了。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Animal Control
passages.content:
The pet shelter volunteer is talking to a pair
of animal control officers.

Animal Control:
So we're looking for a pair of strays who
caused a lot of damage, a black-haired
catgirl and a brown-haired doggirl.

Do you know of anyone who could have done
it?

Shelter Volunteer:
No...\!
I'm sure no one here could have done it...

Animal Control:
Sir!\!
Are you sure it's not the shelter heads?

They look so close!

Animal Control:
Of course not officer!\!
They have too much, uh...

She hefts her chest.

Animal Control:
The ones we're seeking were much less
endowed!

Animal Control:
You have a point...
passages.content_zh:
寵物收容所志工正在與一對夫婦交談
動物管制官員。

動物管制：
所以我們正在尋找一對流浪者
造成了極大的傷害，黑髮
貓女孩和棕色頭髮的狗女孩。

你知道有誰可以做到嗎
它？

庇護所志工：
不...\！
我確信這裡沒有人能做到這一點......

動物管制：
先生！ \!
確定不是避難所的負責人嗎？

他們看起來很親密！

動物管制：
當然不是軍官！ \！
他們的東西太多了，呃...

她挺起胸口。

動物管制：
我們要找的人少很多
賦予！

動物管制：
你說的有道理...

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Unexpected customer — p1
passages.content:
Customer:
Mmmm...

He takes a deep sniff of his catnip tea.

Customer:
This smells de-\!
Delic-\!
De-

He gives an utterly massive sneeze, one that
suddenly rises in pitch halfway through.

There's a flash of light and you're pretty sure
you feel a few scraps of cloth fly past you.

Customer:
Uh...

She stares down at the cat-shaped cutout on
her chest.

Customer:
I can't help but feel this wasn't quite what
was meant to happen...
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
嗯…

他深深吸了一口貓薄荷茶。

客戶：
這聞起來-\！
德利克-\!
德-

他打了一個非常大的噴嚏，
中途音突然升高。

一道閃光出現，你就很確定
你感覺有幾塊布片從你身邊飛過。

客戶：
呃...

她低頭凝視著上面的貓形圖案
她的胸部。

客戶：
我忍不住覺得這不完全是這樣
本來就是要發生的…

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Unexpected customer — p2
passages.content:
She takes another tentative sniff of her catnip
tea.\!
Then gives a cute squeaky sneeze.

This time all her clothes stay intact.

Customer:
You know what, maybe I'm just allergic.
passages.content_zh:
她又試探性地嗅了嗅貓薄荷
茶。 \!
然後打了一個可愛的吱吱作響的噴嚏。

這次她所有的衣服都完好無損。

客戶：
你知道嗎，也許我只是過敏。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Mysterious figure
passages.content:
Cloaked Figure:
This tea is weak and insipid. Watery, tasteless,
and one of the worst things I've ever had the
misfortune to drink.

Shelter Volunteer:
...\!
So are you asking for a refund, or...

They drain the rest of their drink.

Cloaked Figure:
No. Get me another cup.
passages.content_zh:
披風人物：
此茶淡而無味。水汪汪的，無味，
我經歷過的最糟糕的事情之一
喝酒的不幸。

庇護所志工：
...\!
那你是要求退款還是...

他們喝乾了剩下的飲料。

披風人物：
不，再給我一杯。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Volunteer
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Oh great.\!
I forgot that being a cafe meant we'd have to
deal with *customers*.
passages.content_zh:
庇護所志工：
哦，太棒了。 \!
我忘記了作為一家咖啡館意味著我們必須
與*客戶*打交道。

passages.name: Pet shelter 6
passages.content: ADOPTIONS

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Doug — p3
passages.content:
Shelter Head Doug:
Welcome!\!
Thanks again for your help yesterday!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人道格：
歡迎光臨！ \!
再次感謝您昨天的幫忙！

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Shelter volunteer — p2
passages.content:
Shelter Volunteer:
Welcome!\!
Can I get you anything?

I recommend the catnip tea for cat lovers and
the spice tea for dog lovers!

Shelter Volunteer:
Sorry, you don't have enough money!

The tea is delicious!

You feel briefly itchy, as your ears gain a point
and your tail thins down and stretches out.

You feel briefly itchy as your ears gain a point.

Sticks suddenly seem a lot less interesting.\!
You could really go for batting around a mouse,
and maybe licking your butt.

Puppy Power lost!\!
Kitty Claw Cleave learned!

You feel the catnip speaking to something
deep within you.\!
As if a switch in your soul has just changed
from "dog" to "cat".

Something about the catnip is just wonderful
to you.\!
So calming, so soothing...

Sorry, you don't have enough money!

Mmm, the spice tea is wonderful!\!
The best part is chewing on the cinnamon
stick they included.

You pant a little, as your ears flop out and
your tail gets a lot more fluffy.

You pant a little in excitement as your ears
flop out.

The catnip tea is smelling a lot more boring
now.\!
You'd rather go for a walk.\!
Ooo, and maybe chase some squirrels!

Your tail wags eagerly at the thought.

Kitty Claw Cleave lost!\!
Puppy Power learned!

Something about it really makes you want to
chew more sticks.\!
And maybe shoes.\!
Ooo, and chase sticks too!

You feel something shift within your soul.\!
As if a switch deep within you has just
changed from "cat" to "dog".

Sticks are wonderful, aren't they?\!
Yeah!\!
You could chew on this thing forever!

Shelter Volunteer:
Just let me know if you want anything!

passages.name: Pet shelter 6
passages.content: BEVERAGES

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer
passages.content:
Customer:
I've never had catnip tea before, I wonder
how it tastes.
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
我以前從未喝過貓薄荷茶，我想知道

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer
passages.content:
Customer:
I can't have pets in my apartment, so I'm so
glad I can come here to play with them now!
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
我的公寓不能養寵物，所以我很

passages.name: Pet shelter 6 — Customer
passages.content:
Customer:
I'll give the spice tea a try.\!
It's for a good cause, after all.
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
我要嚐嚐香料茶。 \!
畢竟這是有充分理由的。

passages.content:
Customer:
I found the perfect friend!

The cat next to him meows happily.
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
我找到完美的朋友了！

旁邊的貓開心地喵喵叫。

passages.content:
Shelter Head Felix:
It boggles the mind how many people are
showing up for our opening.

We're going to find homes for so many pets!
passages.content_zh:
庇護所負責人菲利克斯：
令人難以置信的是有多少人

我們要為這麼多寵物找到家！

Customer:
I'm going to get the cutest puppy!
passages.content_zh:
客戶：
我要養一隻最可愛的小狗！

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Iterate day — p2
passages.content:
You wake up slightly during the night when
something soft and warm slips into your bed.\!
Purring, it lulls you back to sleep.

// Morning cutscenes. Each cutscene should be wrapped in its own
chack for switch 160, so that only one can trigger.

You are brushing your teeth when you hear a
noise.

Kaede:
Hero \n[10]! 'Tis done!

Kaede:
Thy domicile now hast what any true home
requires: a bath!

And as I am a gracious host, I desire to share
it with all.\!
Cease thy nightly ablutions, the time has come
for water and carousing!

You follow her in.

Your glasses briefly fog up as you enter the
steamy room.

\n[4]:
I didn't think it was possible, but fuzzbrain's
actually made a pretty nice bath.

You have to agree. Somehow, she's managed
to transplant a small forest clearing to your
apartment.

Steaming water bubbles up from the ground,
collecting in a small pool before flowing off to
the north.

Warm mist gently wafts between the soft grass,
more comfortable than any carpet.

You all stare for a moment in wonder.

Kaede:
Come all, 'tis not an experience to be taken
with thine eyes alone!\!
To the bath!

She leaps into the spring, shedding her clothes
as she does.

Kaede:
Come, all that we needst for a most joyous
time ist here!

The water, to sooth aches and pains of body
and mind both!\!
The forest, to calm the mind and lull the
spirit!

She raises a bottle.

Kaede:
And no carouse might be complete without the
libations!

Let us toast ourselves, our heroics, and the
goddesses themselves!

\n[4]:
Yeah, sure, why not.

\n[4]:
It's no magma pool, but I gotta admit this is
pretty refreshing.

\n[2]:
That is nice!

Kaede:
Come fine Hero \n[10], 'tis
plenty of room!

The hot water is looking pretty incredible.\!
Your apartment doesn't even have a tub; it's
been forever since you've had a bath, much
less something like this.

There's only one question.\!
Swimsuit or naked?

You head back to your room for a pair of
swimtrunks.

Then pause, look down at your chest, and
passages.content_zh:
當您在夜間輕微醒來時
一些柔軟而溫暖的東西滑進了你的床上。 \！
咕嚕聲會讓你重新入睡。

// 早上的過場動畫。每個過場動畫都應該包裹在自己的
檢查開關 160，以便只有一個可以觸發。

你正在刷牙，當你聽到「
噪音。

楓：
英雄\n[10]！完成了！

楓：
你的住所現在擁有什麼真正的家
要求：洗澡！

由於我是一位親切的主人，我渴望分享
它與所有。 \！
停止你每晚的沐浴，時間已經到了
喝水和狂歡！

你跟著她進去。

當您進入時，您的眼鏡會短暫起霧
潮濕的房間。

\n[4]:
我不認為這是可能的，但是 fuzzbrain 的
實際上洗了一個很漂亮的澡。

你必須同意。不知怎的，她成功了

公寓。

熱氣騰騰的水從地裡冒出來，
收集在一個小水池中，然後流向
北方。

溫暖的霧氣在柔軟的草地間輕輕飄蕩，
比任何地毯都舒服。

你們都驚訝地盯著看了一會兒。

楓：
來吧，這不是值得經歷的經歷
只用你的眼睛！ \！
去洗澡！

她脫掉衣服，跳入春天
正如她所做的那樣。

楓：
來吧，我們需要的一切都是最快樂的
時間到了！

水，可以舒緩身體的酸痛
並介意兩者！ \！
森林，可以讓心靈平靜下來
精神！

她舉起一個瓶子。

楓：
如果沒有
奠酒！

讓我們為自己、我們的英雄事蹟和
女神本身！

\n[4]:
是的，當然，為什麼不呢。

\n[4]:
這不是岩漿池，但我必須承認這是
相當清爽。

\n[2]:
那太好了！

楓：
英雄加油\n[10]，這
有足夠的空間！

熱水看起來非常令人難以置信。 \！
你的公寓甚至沒有浴缸；這是
自從你洗完澡之後就永遠了
少一些這樣的事情。

只有一個問題。 \!
泳裝還是裸裝？

你回到自己的房間去買一雙
泳褲。

然後停下來，低頭看著你的胸部，然後

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Kaede — p1

Kaede:
This abode lacks some luxury, but 'tis still a
cozy little lovenest!
passages.content_zh:
楓：
這個住所缺乏一些奢華，但仍然是一個

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Kaede — p2
passages.content:
Kaede:
I knowst not how thou hast managed to fit so
many parchements within such a tiny box,
but tis a wonderful way to pass a day.

And 'tis a wonder the heights to which human
creativity has soared!\!
Truly, thou art blessed to live in an age full of

楓：
我不知道你是怎麼做到這樣的
這麼小的盒子裡有很多羊皮紙，

人類所能達到的高度真是個奇蹟

確實，你很幸運生活在一個充滿了
這樣的故事。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Elina — p1
passages.content:
\n[2]:
Thank you for the room \n[10]!

Maybe now everyone will stop being so

How are they so bad at it?
passages.content_zh:
\n[2]:
感謝您提供房間\n[10]！

也許現在每個人都將不再如此

他們怎麼這麼差勁呢？

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Elina — p3
passages.content:
\n[2]:
A computer all my own!\!
It's fascinating!

Did you know a group of hippos is called a
"bloat"?

Also that hippos exist?\!
And a continent called "Africa"?

And continents!\!
There are seven of them!\!
On a round planet!

Oh, and there's this thing called "space"...
passages.content_zh:
\n[2]:
我自己的電腦！ \！
太迷人了！

你知道一群河馬被稱為
“膨脹”？

那河馬也存在嗎？ \！
還有一個叫做「非洲」的大陸？

還有大陸！ \！
他們有七個！ \！
在一個圓形的星球上！

哦，還有一個叫做「空間」的東西...

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride — p1
passages.content:
\n[4] is pacing back and forth, muttering to
herself.

\n[4]:
Okay, so what if the world turned out to be
bigger than I thought?\!
So what if what I knew was wrong.

It's just a new challenge!

Just need to figure out the levers of power
in this new world. \!
Money?\!
Money's always a good one.

She notices you.

\n[4]:
Hey, \n[10], thanks for the room.

And I actually mean that in a totally sincere
and non-sarcastic way.

It's got real underworld lava and everything.\!
Very homey.

But do you think the department store could
also get me one of those computer things?

I need to do research. For reasons.
passages.content_zh:
\n[4] 來回踱步，嘀咕著
她自己。

\n[4]:
好吧，如果世界變成這樣又怎麼樣
比我想像的還要大？ \!
如果我所知道的都是錯的又如何呢？

這只是一個新的挑戰！

只需要弄清楚權力的槓桿
在這個新世界裡。 \！
錢？ \！
有錢總是好的。

她注意到你了。

\n[4]:
嘿，\n[10]，謝謝你的房間。

我的意思是完全真誠地
和非諷刺的方式。

它有真正的地下熔岩和一切。 \！
非常溫馨。

但你認為百貨公司可以嗎？
還給我一件電腦上的東西嗎？

我需要做研究。出於原因。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride — p2
passages.content:
\n[4] is pacing back and forth, muttering to
herself.

\n[4]:
Okay, money.\!
So many ways to make money.

How to leverage them?

She notices you.

\n[4]:
Yes, excellent, the computer is just what I
need!

You remind her she promised to hold off on
conquering the world until *after* you've
resolved this whole Arcadia situation.

\n[4]:
Of course!

\n[4]:
Please. I'm barely scheming at all!

At *most* I might get us a little more power.

There's nothing to worry about!

\n[4]:
For you.

You give her an unimpressed look.

\n[4]:
Okay, I'm just trying to procure some
additional funds.

Through entirely \}technically\{ legal means.

You sigh.\!
As long as she's sure whatever she's up to
won't backfire on you all.

\n[4]:
Of course not!\!
Just wait and see, I promise this is genius.
passages.content_zh:
\n[4] 來回踱步，嘀咕著
她自己。

\n[4]:
好吧，錢。 \!
賺錢的方法有很多。

如何利用它們？

她注意到你了。

\n[4]:
是的，很好，電腦正是我想要的
需要！

你提醒她她答應延後
征服世界，直到你*之後*
解決了整個阿卡迪亞的情況。

\n[4]:
當然！

\n[4]:
請。我根本就沒有什麼陰謀啊！

「最多」我可能會為我們帶來更多的力量。

沒什麼好擔心的！

\n[4]:
為了你。

你給她一個不為所動的表情。

\n[4]:
好吧，我只是想購買一些
額外資金。

完全透過\}技術\{合法手段。

你嘆息。 \!
只要她確定自己在做什麼
不會對你們所有人產生適得其反的效果。

\n[4]:
當然不是！ \!
等著瞧吧，我保證這是天才。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG
passages.content:
A browser is open to Wikipedia.

About 150 tabs in it are open to Wikipedia.
passages.content_zh:
瀏覽器對維基百科開放。

其中大約 150 個選項卡向維基百科開放。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG
passages.content:
A browser is open to a bunch of sites with
names like "$$$$Make Money FAST!!!!$$$$"
passages.content_zh:
瀏覽器對一堆網站開放
諸如“$$$$快速賺錢!!!!$$$$”之類的名字

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride computer chair — p2
passages.content:
\n[4]:
Be prepared!\!
Tomorrow I shall once more release my
genius, and the world shall cower before us!

...Peacefully and heroically.
passages.content_zh:
\n[4]:
做好準備！ \!
明天我將再次釋放我的
天才，世界將在我們面前畏縮！

……和平而英勇。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride computer chair — p3
passages.content:
\n[4]:
Are you ready to go rescue my foolish
minions yet?!\!
Time is money!

Even if I haven't figured out how to convert
it.\!
(Maybe the right magic...)

Head out?
passages.content_zh:
\n[4]:
你準備好去拯救我的傻瓜了嗎
奴才還沒？ ！ \！
時間就是金錢！

即使我還沒弄清楚如何轉換
它。 \!
（也許是正確的魔法…）

出去嗎？

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride computer chair — p4
passages.content:
\n[4] is busy working through a dozen
business spreadsheets.

\n[4]:
(And the most profitable method to
incorporate the business is...)

\n[4]:
Well, that did not work out as planned, but
once more we see that a genius can extract
gold from even the most foolish of dross!
passages.content_zh:
\n[4] 正忙著處理一打
業務電子表格。

\n[4]:
（最賺錢的方法
合併業務是...）

\n[4]:
嗯，這並沒有按計劃進行，但是
我們再次看到天才可以提取
即使是最愚蠢的渣滓也能煉成黃金！

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG
passages.content:
A browser is open to google.\!
Someone has been searching for "places
where I might slake mine lusts."

Wow.\!
That's a *lot* of porn.
passages.content_zh:
瀏覽器已向 google 開放。 \!
有人一直在尋找“地方”
在那裡我可以滿足我的慾望。 」

哇。 \！
這是「很多」色情內容。

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride shenanigans  — p1
passages.content:
\n[4] calls you over to the computer as you
come in.

\n[4]:
Mwahaha, \n[10], come and gaze upon
my genius!

As promised I have found a source of funds
to help us in our fight!

You ask her what she's figured out.

\n[4]:
Behold!\!
Non-fungible tokens!

\n[4]:
Yes, befuddlement is exactly what I would
expect from anyone not possessing my
genius.

(I will refrain from telling fuzzbrain, her tiny
perverted brain might explode.)

You see, these tokens, these "NFTs", are
practically the perfect item to sell.

You're selling people a picture.\!
But not a real picture, there's no need to
actually make anything.\!
It's a picture on the computer.

But you're not even selling them the computer
picture, you're selling them a note that says
they have the right to look at the picture!

She sighes happily.

\n[4]:
So little work for such a payoff, even the greed
spirits would be jealous.

And thanks to my genius it is fully within our
grasp!

Sure.\!
Sure, this sounds entirely legitimate and
unlikely to go wrong in any way.

\n[4]:
Not with my genius running the show!

See, look.

She turns back to the computer and pulls up
a file.

\n[4]:
I've already sourced the art.

She scrolls through a set of images of the
sexier characters you've interacted with from
the game.

\n[4]:
I'm making those fools behind all this
nonsense work for us!

And don't worry, I checked and it's *very*
uncommon for someone to sue for copyright
infringement after they've been exploded into
tiny pieces.

I've put together the advertising campaign.\!
I've done the initial sales projections.\!
I've even found the minions to mint the NFTs
for me!

Tomorrow we release, and then we will be
simply rolling in the money.\!
And even a dark goddess must bow before
the power of enough wealth!

She leans back and stretches happily.

\n[4]:
I will allow you to praise me for my genius.
passages.content_zh:
\n[4] 在您進行操作時將您叫到計算機
進來吧。

\n[4]:
哇哈哈，\n[10]，過來看看
我的天才！

正如承諾的，我找到了資金來源
幫助我們戰鬥！

你問她想到了什麼。

\n[4]:
看哪！ \!
不可替代的代幣！

\n[4]:
是的，困惑正是我想要的
期望任何人不擁有我的
天才。

（我不會告訴fuzzbrain，她的小
變態的大腦可能會爆炸。 ）

你看，這些代幣，這些“NFT”，是
幾乎是完美的出售物品。

你在向人推銷一張照片。 \!
但不是真圖，沒必要
實際上做任何事情。 \！
這是電腦上的圖片。

但你甚至不賣他們電腦
圖片，你在賣給他們一張紙條，上面寫著
他們有權利看照片！

她幸福地嘆了口氣。

\n[4]:
即使是貪婪，也很少有工作能得到這樣的回報
靈魂會嫉妒。

感謝我的天才，它完全在我們的範圍之內
把握！

當然。 \！
當然，這聽起來完全合法且
無論如何都不太可能出錯。

\n[4]:
不是由我的天才主持的！

看，看。

她轉回電腦前並停下來
一個文件。

\n[4]:
我已經找到藝術品的來源了。

她滾動瀏覽一組圖像
與您互動過的更性感的角色
遊戲。

\n[4]:
我在這一切背後讓那些傻瓜
對我們來說毫無意義的工作！

別擔心，我查了一下，它*非常*
某人起訴版權的情況並不常見

passages.name: Apartment 3 ARG — Pride shenanigans  — p3
passages.content:
